page.title: 02Bells Yew Green Chapel
page.content: There is an old chapel in Bells Yew Green. The chapel is sometimes used for whist-drives, coffee mornings,etc. A house next to the chapel was built on, but it has not always been like this. The{number of people attending the chapel over the years has fallen. There used to be about 3 services per week in the chapel. The people call themselves{Congregationalists.} The {Countess of Huntingdon}sold all her jewellery to enable small chapels like the one in Bells Yew Green to form. The woman who lives in the house joined to the chapel met her husband there, and they married there. In 1985 they were 89 and 92 years old. They are not official caretakers of the chapel, but they have the keys and take good care of it. It holds about 20 people. It is carpeted and cosy.
